description: From Middle English forbarren (“to bar, bar up, block”), equivalent to for- +‎ bar. Compare Middle High German verbarren (“to forbar”).

verbs.description: forbar (third-person singular simple present forbars, present participle forbarring, simple past and past participle forbarred)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To bar in; to shut up.
(obsolete, transitive) To bar, fend off, ward off.
